macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: HashKey Capital raises $250M for new crypto fund; HK-listed stock jumps ~4%
items.summary: HashKey Capital announced a $250 million close for a new multi-strategy crypto fund focused on blockchain infrastructure and mass-adoption use cases, with the firm targeting a $500 million final fund size; HashKey’s Hong Kong–listed stock rose about 4% after the announcement.[3]

items.title: Aptos (APT) price dips amid broader market weakness
items.summary: Aptos' native token APT fell as it tracked broader crypto market weakness during range trading, reflecting continued short-term selling pressure in mid/late December markets.[5]

items.title: Crypto investors saw policy wins in 2025 but prices still fell; Clarity Act eyed as 2026 catalyst
items.summary: Despite major regulatory and institutional developments during 2025, digital-asset prices underperformed; analysts note that pending U.S. legislation (the Clarity Act) and other policy moves could be key catalysts in 2026.[1]

items.title: Year-in-review: top crypto winners of 2025 and sector trends
items.summary: CryptoSlate highlights the leading crypto 'winners' of 2025 and sector themes — including gains in Solana and XRP, growth in stablecoins and on-chain derivatives, privacy protocol progress, and institutional product expansion into 2026.[2]

items.title: Report: major banks planning large lobbying push to blunt crypto's political influence
items.summary: Analysis reports that big banks are preparing to spend roughly $100 million on lobbying and influence efforts ahead of 2026 elections to counter crypto advocacy and shape policy debates.[6]

items.title: Bitcoin-focused firm increases BTC holdings significantly amid market repositioning
items.summary: Investor/asset-manager disclosures show substantial increases in Bitcoin allocations, with one firm reporting a large percent increase in holdings as part of a strategy to capitalize on the $18B segment opportunity.[4]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Meta layoffs, restructuring and AI-driven ad targeting amid 2025 pivot
items.summary: Meta announced large-scale restructuring in 2025 including hundreds of AI job cuts and a renewed focus on breakthrough AI initiatives while its AI features powered highly personalized ad targeting for over a billion users, intensifying scrutiny of its AI strategy and costs[1].

items.title: Christmas tree farms adopt drones and AI for planting, counting and monitoring
items.summary: Farms are increasingly using drones, satellite imaging, LiDAR and machine‑learning computer vision to map plantations, ID and count trees (up to 98% accuracy) and enable targeted spraying and growth tracking, speeding inspections from days to minutes[2].

items.title: Nvidia licensing deal reportedly brings engineers from Groq, boosting chip talent
items.summary: A reported Nvidia licensing agreement includes hiring top engineers from AI chip startup Groq — including an engineer involved with Google’s TPU program — highlighting aggressive talent moves in the AI‑chip race[3].

items.title: Tuya Smart launches 'Hey Tuya' Super AI Life Assistant for physical AI
items.summary: Tuya Smart unveiled 'Hey Tuya', a multimodal, multi-agent 'Super AI Life Assistant' designed to integrate across devices with short‑ and long‑term memory, edge acceleration and continuous learning to provide proactive home and IoT automation[4].

items.title: Newera.ai closes $2.13M pre-seed to advance generative AI for businesses
items.summary: Saudi-based Newera.ai raised $2.13 million in a pre-seed round to develop generative AI solutions for enterprise customers, reflecting ongoing investment in regionally focused AI startups[6].

items.title: AI reshapes customer experience and agentic AI discussion
items.summary: Industry commentary emphasizes agentic AI's potential to shift consumer behavior—AI agents making decisions or purchases on users' behalf—urging businesses to redesign products and CX around machine-led interactions[5].

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Fortnite experiences widespread login outages during holiday Winterfest event
items.summary: Players reported global login and authentication failures for Fortnite across consoles, PC and mobile during Christmas Eve and Christmas Day amid the game's Winterfest 2025 event; Epic acknowledged the issue and said it was investigating while Winterfest activity and high player traffic likely intensified the disruption.[2][1]
items.source: The Times of India / SSB Crack

items.title: Rocket League hit by large outage tied to Epic Online Services
items.summary: Rocket League players faced a major outage affecting logins and matchmaking across platforms on Dec. 24–25, 2025; Psyonix said it was investigating and the disruption was linked to Epic Online Services issues impacting multiple titles.[6]

items.title: Holiday gaming traffic strains multiplayer services during Winterfest window
items.summary: Reports and analysis indicate holiday player surges combined with Winterfest 2025 content (collabs like Harry Potter and SpongeBob plus new in-game items) increased server load and exposed authentication/maintenance vulnerabilities across Epic-operated services.[1][2]
items.source: SSB Crack / The Times of India

items.title: Community and streamer events mark Christmas gaming livestreams
items.summary: Live coverage and community streams continued over the holiday period with themed sessions (for example Frostfall/Cloudheim streams), as creators and outlets hosted seasonal shows and special co-op play despite service outages affecting some multiplayer titles.[3]

items.title: Roundups highlight 2025's oddest brand-game crossovers
items.summary: End-of-year pieces are cataloguing 2025's stranger collaborations and crossovers between games and non-gaming brands — a trend observers say helped drive engagement but also fueled debate about over-collaboration in major live-service titles.[9]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
